conclusion: The problem involves predicting which container (E, F, or G) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows out from containers A, B, C, and D.
The image shows containers labeled A, B, C, and D connected by baffles to containers E, F, and G. Flow paths are illustrated with different colors.
The yellow path leads from D to F.
The blue path leads from C to G.
The white path leads from B to E.
The black path leads from A to G.

premise: The yellow path leads from D to F.
conclusion: Liquid flows from D into F.

premise: The blue path leads from C to G.
conclusion: Liquid flows from C into G.

premise: The white path leads from B to E.
conclusion: Liquid flows from B into E.

premise: The black path leads from A to G.
conclusion: Liquid flows from A into G.

premise: Liquid flows from A, B, C, and D into containers E, F, and G based on the paths indicated by color.
conclusion: Liquid from B flows into E, liquid from C flows into G, and liquid from A flows into G.

premise: Liquid flows from A, B, C, and D into containers E, F, and G.
conclusion: Containers E, F, and G receive liquid.
